moves.1. d4: Normally the KP opening leads to faster wins. But opening traps can occur anywhere...
moves.2. c4: Theory dictates this is by far the best 2nd move in this position.
moves.3... dxc4: A delayed QGA, where both men developed their QN's before the Pawn capture.
moves.5. Bf4: Marshall continues his development, and since it's a QP opening, he focuses on the invasion point at QB7 instead of KB7.
moves.5... Bd7: Tchigorin cautiously continues his own development. He aims to move his KP and clear lines for developing the K-side.
moves.6. e4: Anticipating this plan, Marshall sets a clever trap.
moves.7. dxe6: Giving Tchigorin one safe and one disastrous way to recapture.
moves.7... fxe6: Tchigorin picks the wrong move. 7... BxP leaves him in a perfectly safe position.
moves.8. Qh5+: Picks up the unprotected Knight at Black's QR4. Tchigorin resigns at once.
